meanings.definition: Capable of being strengthened or supported.
meanings.sent1: The old bridge was reinforceable with new steel beams.
meanings.sent2: Adding extra layers of paint made the wall more reinforceable.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's cape was so reinforceable, it could withstand any villain's attack.
meanings.sent4: Her resolve to succeed was as reinforceable as a fortress wall.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's praise was a reinforceable source of motivation for the students.

meanings.definition: Able to be made stronger or more effective.
meanings.sent1: The team's strategy was reinforceable with better communication.
meanings.sent2: Regular exercise can make your muscles more reinforceable.
meanings.sent3: The recipe for chocolate cake became even more reinforceable with extra cocoa powder.
meanings.sent4: His argument was as reinforceable as a well-built house.
meanings.sent5: The antivirus software provided reinforceable protection against online threats.
